Symfony2 BigBang edition

View On GitHub

    Installation

    We recommend to use Composer in order to create a new project based on this edition.

    Use the create-project command to generate a new Symfony application:

    $ php composer.phar create-project flub/symfony-bigbang-edition path/to/install 2.2.1

    Composer will install Symfony and all its dependencies under the path/to/install directory.

    Features

    Var directory

    BigBang edition changes the standard way to store cache and log files. They are in the var directory, at the root of your project, and follow this architecture :

    +- app
+- src
+- var
   +- cache
   |  +- dev
   |  +- prod
   |  +- test
   +- logs
   +- sessions
+- vendor

    You can see that the PHP sessions files are also stored in the var directory (and not in the cache directory contrary to the standard edition). That allow to keep sessions even if the cache is cleared.

    KnpRadBundle

    This edition includes the KnpRadBundle but it is not enabled in the AppKernel by default. You can use and extend classes like that but if you want use services prodvided by this bundle you have to enable it.

    More informations on the KnpRadBundle dedicated documentation.
